Hi Emma — I tried to find Bob’s issue in emmajohnson/file_compression but I couldn’t access the repository or the issue. Here’s what I tried and what I need to proceed.

What I tried
- Queried the repository name emmajohnson/file_compression (no results / access blocked).
- Queried file_compression (not found).
- Opened https://github.com/emmajohnson/file_compression/issues in a browser — returned 404.

Why I couldn’t find the issue
- The repo name or owner might be different (typo or organization account).
- The repository may be private or has been renamed/deleted.
- The issue URL you referenced may be for a different repo or user.

Options to let me proceed (pick any)
1. Share the exact issue URL (https://github.com/OWNER/REPO/issues/NUMBER). I’ll fetch it and act.
2. If the repo is private, either:
   - Make the issue text available here (paste the issue description, error messages, and any logs), or
   - Provide a public link or grant read access to the repository (if you want me to open a PR I’ll need push/collaborator access or you can apply the patch I produce).
3. Tell me the exact repo path if it’s under a different account/org (e.g., BlueSparrowTech/file_compression).
4. Upload the relevant files or a minimal repro (copy/paste code or attach a zip) so I can reproduce locally.

What I will do once I can access the issue/repo
- Read Bob’s issue and reproduction steps.
- Reproduce the problem locally (run tests or a minimal repro).
- Create a fix branch, implement and test a fix, add unit tests if appropriate.
- Push the branch and open a PR with a clear description and changelog.
- Post a clear response on the issue explaining the fix and next steps.

Draft reply you can post to Bob right now (if you want to acknowledge the issue immediately)
Hi Bob — thanks for reporting this. I’m looking into it now but I don’t yet have the details I need to reproduce the problem. Could you please share:
- Exact steps to reproduce

- OS and language/runtime versions (e.g., Python 3.9)
I’ll prioritize a fix as soon as I can reproduce. Thanks for your patience — Emma

Next step for me
- Paste the issue URL or the issue text here (or grant access / tell me the correct repo path) and I’ll automatically retrieve the issue, reproduce, and prepare a fix and PR.
